Other fevers
Typhoid  
Typhoid fever is a disease caused by a germ which enters the body through contaminated (unclean or impure) food or water.  It commonly occurs in the 
summer and rainy season. It starts with:
✱  Mild fever which slowly rises to moderate and high.
✱  Headache.
✱  Pain in the stomach with diarrhoea symptoms.
✱  Within 7-10 days, the person gradually becomes very sick. There can be 
drowsiness (feeling of sleepiness), severe pain in the abdomen, constipation, 
and even bleeding from the intestines.
What to do in suspected typhoid
✱  In case typhoid is suspected, the health care provider or 
health centre must be consulted without delay.
✱  Medicines should be taken according to the dosage and for the duration prescribed.
